meanings.definition: The act of disconnecting or separating from something.
meanings.sent1: Her disassociation from the toxic relationship was a brave decision.
meanings.sent2: The disassociation of the puzzle pieces made it challenging to complete the picture.
meanings.sent3: The disassociation of the cat from its shadow in the dark room led to a funny chase.
meanings.sent4: The disassociation of colors in the painting created a unique and abstract effect.
meanings.sent5: The disassociation of the student from distractions helped improve focus during study sessions.

meanings.definition: A state of being disconnected or separated from something.
meanings.sent1: The disassociation of the internet connection left them unable to finish the online game.
meanings.sent2: His disassociation from reality was evident in his dreamy gaze.
meanings.sent3: The disassociation of the keys from the keychain caused a moment of panic.
meanings.sent4: The disassociation of the planets from their orbits would cause chaos in the solar system.
meanings.sent5: The disassociation of the book from its owner led to a mix-up at the library.

meanings.definition: To dissociate or separate oneself from a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: She decided to disassociate herself from the negative influences in her life.
meanings.sent2: He disassociated from the political party due to differences in beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to disassociate from the costume by wriggling out of it.
meanings.sent4: The artist's goal was to disassociate from traditional styles and create something new.
meanings.sent5: It is important to disassociate from harmful habits to lead a healthier lifestyle.
